originalText.text:
Firstly, I am not one to leave reviews. However, I feel compelled to leave a review following my appointment with Dr Lily. She had the worst bedside manner Iâ€™ve ever experienced. Rolled her eyes repeatedly.
Your personal health is the most important and Manhattan is full of wonderful doctors.

Strongly encourage you not to book here.

originalText.text: Dr. Wong is incredibly kind and patient. Iâ€™m sorry for those who left bad reviews, citing a cold bedside manner. I experienced the complete opposite. She made me feel very comfortable, answered all my questions, and didnâ€™t rush me at all.

text.text: Dr. Wong is incredibly kind and patient. Iâ€™m sorry for those who left bad reviews, citing a cold bedside manner. I experienced the complete opposite. She made me feel very comfortable, answered all my questions, and didnâ€™t rush me at all.

originalText.text: I've been going to Dr Wong for over 20 years, initially because my mother was also a patient. Dr Wong is caring, compassionate, and professional, and she also provides recommendations for excellent physicians in other specialties upon request. I found my wonderful primary care, ENT, and endocrinology doctors through her. The office staff is also friendly and helpful, and I have never had a long wait at my appointments.

text.text: I've been going to Dr Wong for over 20 years, initially because my mother was also a patient. Dr Wong is caring, compassionate, and professional, and she also provides recommendations for excellent physicians in other specialties upon request. I found my wonderful primary care, ENT, and endocrinology doctors through her. The office staff is also friendly and helpful, and I have never had a long wait at my appointments.

originalText.text:
I have never encountered such a truly horrible and plainly cold and uncaring doctor, gynecologist or otherwise, as I did in Dr. Lily Wong. To say she has a poor bedside manner is putting it quite mildly. At first, she feigned some fake empathy that was easy to pick up on in hindsight but after those initial minutes, it transitioned to an icy experience. She was unnecessarily sarcastic at times as well with responses that weren't called for or helpful. After that visit, I was determined that my (first) visit with her would be my last. When I left, I made sure to research a different GYN to use in the future.

Of course then there's her medical knowledge and expertise, which you may or may not find questionable and dubious at best. To provide some background, I saw Dr. Lily Wong for the first time last year for my first annual GYN exam since covid came around. So this was my first visit to the GYN in 3 years.

First off, for an "annual women's wellness exam," Dr. Lily Wong barely spent more than a minute or 2 working/examining "down there." In fact, I think I actually spent more time putting on and removing the exam gown they hand you right before your exam. ðŸ™„ Secondly, I realized only after the fact that Dr. Lily Wong did not even perform a Pap smear or pelvic exam during this visit. She did not even offer to do a Pap smear even though my last one had been 3 years (and counting) ago. So much for an "annual women's wellness exam," huh! What a waste of my time and a complete waste of a visit.

I was only vividly reminded about this past visit to her when the front desk at the Chinatown clinic she works at a few times per week reached out a few months ago to let me know that Dr. Loly Wong wanted me to schedule an appointment for a six-month follow-up for an issue she had found particularly concerning at the time of my first visit. Well, that was certainly news to my ears since she had never communicated having to schedule a six-month follow-up at any point during my visit.

Anyway, I booked an appointment with my new GYN to do this six-month follow-up/give a second opinion, who confirmed to me that Dr. Lily Wong indeed misdiagnosed me when she kept fixating on the "issue" that she thought was so especially concerning (more concerning than doing a PAP smear for the first time in 3 years! As well as performing a pelvic exam!). I asked the new GYN if in fact this issue that Dr. Lily Wong thought was so concerning was indeed something to be concerned about and she bluntly yet kindly responded, "No." Additionally, the new GYN did a Pap smear and a pelvic exam without my having to prompt her to do it!

I guess the silver lining, if there could actually be one, in this very subpar experience with Dr. Loly Wong is that she made me realize and see for myself how truly wonderful and amazing **other** GYNs can be in contrast!

Do not recommend. Avoid this GYN at all costs, if you can. This is NYC - there are much better gynecologists out there to be found.

originalText.text: Dr. Wong and her team have the most amazing bed side manner. I switched from my previous gynecologist because she was not very compassionate, and I am so pleased with how kind and thoughtful the team here is. It is obvious they truly care for their patients.
